intro: Senecio hygrophilus, commonly known as the water-loving groundsel, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist or wet environments, such as marshes and stream banks. The plant features upright stems covered in fine hairs and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a slightly serrated margin. Senecio hygrophilus is often found in areas with high humidity and is adapted to thrive in waterlogged soils.
